title: CEP Exchange Role Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for the roles that entities play in CEP Exchange records (sourceEntity, recipientEntity, intermediaryEntities).

terms.label: Disbursing Agency
terms.definition: A government agency responsible for authorizing and issuing payment in a grant, contract, or other public expenditure.

terms.label: Pass-Through Entity
terms.definition: An entity that receives funds from an original source and passes them on to one or more subrecipients while retaining oversight responsibilities.

terms.label: Prime Contractor
terms.definition: A contractor that has a direct contractual relationship with a government entity and primary responsibility for performance.

terms.label: Subcontractor
terms.definition: An entity that has a contractual relationship with a prime contractor or another subcontractor to carry out part of the work under a prime contract.

terms.label: Grantee
terms.definition: An entity that receives funds or other support under a grant, cooperative agreement, or similar assistance instrument.

terms.label: Subrecipient
terms.definition: A non-federal entity that receives a subaward from a pass-through entity to carry out part of a federal program.

terms.label: Payer of Record
terms.definition: The entity recorded as the paying party for the purposes of accounting, reporting, and audit, which may differ from the ultimate source of funds.

terms.label: Payee of Record
terms.definition: The entity recorded as the recipient of payment for accounting and reporting purposes, which may be different from the ultimate beneficiary.
